page.title: 03POPULATION & EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Having remained reasonably static for many years the population is now 1520. 21% are aged 65 or over - the male retirement age. 57% are between 18 and 65; 15% between 5 and 18 and 7% under 5, when school starts. 10 families, 9% of the population, have roots in the village back over 100 years. Some 50 families move into or out of the village annually. 12% of the adults below 65 work in Aldbourne, mostly in building and allied trades. Shops and small businesses employ others: farming is still the major industry, but with much reduced manpower. Many are employed in varied trades and industries in Swindon, Marlborough, Newbury and Hungerford and as far as London and Bristol. Many local people are employed at one of Europes biggest egg packing stations at Membury. Less than 2% are unemployed
